snippet: Irina Dovgan was wrapped in a Ukrainian flag and forced to stand on a sidewalk while holding a sign that read “She kills our children,” as passers-by slapped, kicked and spit on her.
abstract: Irina Dovgan, Ukranian woman who was detained by pro-Russian separatists near her home in eastern Ukraine and subjected to public beatings and mock executions, is released and allowed to leave rebel-controlled territory.
lead_paragraph: Irina Dovgan was wrapped in a Ukrainian flag and forced to stand on a sidewalk while holding a sign that read “She kills our children,” as passers-by slapped, kicked and spit on her.

headline.main: Ukrainian Woman, Held Up to Public Abuse, Is Released
headline.print_headline: Ukrainian Woman, Held Up to Public Abuse, Is Released

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
